p: The spectra of 1H NMR proton of PAMAM G4.0 is shown in Figure 1. As shown in Figure 1, the protons at 2.351 ppm, 2.55 ppm, 2.77 ppm, 3.04 ppm and 3.23 ppm were assigned to protons in methylene groups of –CH 2–CO–NH (peak d), CH 2–N– (peak b), –CH 2–NH 2– (peak a), –N–CH 2–CH 2– (peak e), and –CO–NH–CH 2 (peak c). The presence of all these signals demonstrated that PAMAM G4.0 was successfully synthesized and characterized based on other studies in NMR characterization of fourth-generation PAMAM [ 13, 16].
